article.headline: Trump deletes tweet of video showing supporter yelling âwhite powerâ after Republican lawmaker complains
article.body: President Donald Trump on Sunday deleted his retweet of a video where one of his supporters can be heard yelling, âWhite power!â The removal of the tweet came shortly after Sen. Tim Scott, a Republican from South Carolina, called the video a âterrible displayâ in an interview on television. âHe should take it down â there isnât much to be said,â Scott said, during an interview on CBSâs âFace the Nation.â The video showed a parade of supporters of the president riding golf carts through the sprawling retirement community in central Florida called âThe Villages.â Detractors of the presidentâs were on the sidewalk holding signs, and both sides can be heard hurling verbal abuse. After one incident were heated words were exchanged, one driver of a golf cart with a Trump sign in the windshield yelled, âWhite power! White power!â while driving away and shaking a fist. A White House spokesman said Trump had not heard that part of the clip. When he shared the video, the president wrote, â[T]hank you to the great people of The Villages.â
